table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;
border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Dispensing a medication to a named patient. This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.

tr.td: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

tr.td:
in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped
MedicationDispenseStatus (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The individual responsible for dispensing the medication.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

tr.td: Medication order that authorizes the dispense

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

tr.td:
Details for individual dispensed medicationdetails
whenHandedOver cannot be before whenPrepared

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility. This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

tr.td:
in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped
MedicationDispenseStatus (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

tr.td:
Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
MedicationDispenseType (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4/x0ISQIM/0kGANNnY41GtlCWAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the person who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their carer, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

tr.td: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFklEQVR42mP4//3/fyAGkUQChv8kAwDQh2OFKjeEPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFklEQVR42mP4//3/fyAGkUQChv8kAwDQh2OFKjeEPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFklEQVR42mP4//3/fyAGkUQChv8kAwDQh2OFKjeEPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFklEQVR42mP4//3/fyAGkUQChv8kAwDQh2OFKjeEPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose. If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFklEQVR42mP4//3/fyAGkUQChv8kAwDQh2OFKjeEPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: Value of "true" or "false"

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body.

tr.td:
Body site to administer to
MedicationAdministrationSite (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

tr.td:
How drug should enter body
RouteOfAdministration (??)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title:
A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV.
Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4//3/fzAmGjD8JxkAANN3Y41G2ceBAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.

tr.td: Amount of medication per unit of time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

tr.td: Upper limit on medication per unit of time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

tr.td: Deals with substitution of one medicine for another

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TzJgIF0LANmXY523xFiMAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

tr.td: Who is responsible for the substitution

purpose.value: This is the definition for the MedicationDispense resource

short.value: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

formal.value: Dispensing a medication to a named patient. This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

formal.value: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

short.value: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

formal.value: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

description.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

map.value: (Not clear whether or how V2 provides for a snapshot of dispense status)

formal.value: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
The individual responsible for dispensing the medication.

map.value: RXD-10-Dispensing Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='DP' (RXD-10 is deprecated)

short.value: Medication order that authorizes the dispense

formal.value: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

map.value: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

formal.value: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

xpath.value: not(exists(f:whenHandedOver/@value)) or not(exists(f:whenPrepared/@value)) or ( f:whenHandedOver/@value >= f:whenPrepared/@value)

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility. This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

short.value: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

formal.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

description.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

short.value: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.

formal.value: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

description.value: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

formal.value: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

map.value: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

formal.value: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

comments.value: Note: do not use Medication.name to describe the dispensed medication. When the only available information is a text description of the medication, Medication.code.text should be used.

formal.value: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.
The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.
Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

map.value: RXD-13-Dispense-to Location; RXD-30-Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31-Dispense to Pharmacy Address (V2 (in definition of RXD-13, RXD-30 and RXD-31) directs use of the PRT segment but there doesn't appear to be a standard code in Table 0912 suitable for PRT-4-Participation)

formal.value: Identifies the person who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their carer, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

short.value: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer

formal.value: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.

The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose. If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication.

description.value: A coded concept identifying the pre-condition that should hold prior to consuming a medication dose. For example "pain", "30 minutes prior to sexual intercourse", "on flare-up", etc.

map.value:
boolean: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PRCN].negationInd (inversed - so negationInd = true means asNeeded=false
CodeableConcept: .outboundRelationship[typCode=PRCN].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, isCriterionInd=true, code="Assertion"].value

formal.value: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body.

description.value: A coded concept describing the site location the medicine enters into or onto the body

formal.value: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

description.value: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

formal.value:
A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV.
Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.

description.value: A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered

formal.value: The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

map.value: RXE-23-Give Rate Amount / RXE-24.1-Give Rate Units.code / RXE-24.3-Give Rate Units.name of coding system

short.value: Amount of medication per unit of time

formal.value: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.

short.value: Upper limit on medication per unit of time

formal.value: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

short.value: Deals with substitution of one medicine for another

formal.value: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

description.value: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription

formal.value: Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

description.value: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

short.value: Who is responsible for the substitution

formal.value: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

short.value: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

formal.value: Dispensing a medication to a named patient. This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.
Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

short.value: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

formal.value: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

description.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

map.value: (Not clear whether or how V2 provides for a snapshot of dispense status)

formal.value: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
The individual responsible for dispensing the medication.

map.value: RXD-10-Dispensing Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='DP' (RXD-10 is deprecated)

short.value: Medication order that authorizes the dispense

formal.value: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

map.value: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

formal.value: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of medication dispensed.

xpath.value: not(exists(f:whenHandedOver/@value)) or not(exists(f:whenPrepared/@value)) or ( f:whenHandedOver/@value >= f:whenPrepared/@value)

formal.value: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility. This is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

short.value: in progress | on hold | completed | entered in error | stopped

formal.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

description.value: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

short.value: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.

formal.value: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

description.value: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

formal.value: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

map.value: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

formal.value: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

comments.value: Note: do not use Medication.name to describe the dispensed medication. When the only available information is a text description of the medication, Medication.code.text should be used.

formal.value: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.
The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.
Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

map.value: RXD-13-Dispense-to Location; RXD-30-Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31-Dispense to Pharmacy Address (V2 (in definition of RXD-13, RXD-30 and RXD-31) directs use of the PRT segment but there doesn't appear to be a standard code in Table 0912 suitable for PRT-4-Participation)

formal.value: Identifies the person who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their carer, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

short.value: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer

formal.value: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.

If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose. If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication.

documentation.value: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)
The stated language of the resource
Return dispenses that should be sent to a secific destination
Return all dispenses performed by a specific indiividual
Return dispenses with this external identity
The identity of a patient to list dispenses for
The identity of a prescription to list dispenses from
Return all dispenses with the specified responsible party
Return all dispenses of a specific type
Date when medication handed over to patient (outpatient setting), or supplied to ward or clinic (inpatient setting)
